messages.message: Hi EPD, I would like to regression test some of my scripts that i have wrote across our major instances using a CI/CD pipeline. What would be the best course of action to do so. I know we have major sandbox instances but curious if we have a shared s3 bucket across them that i could use the flow api to kick off the job to get the results from 22.01 / 5 / 8 / 10 etc
@joshbronko Are these scripts part of a flow or solution?
I could wrap them into a ibsolution but ideally I would want each commit into my master branch. I could create a ibsolution dynamically if need be
It would be a refiner UDF that I would like to test thru a flow and validate the results

We have a way to regression test flows and solutions through TestRunner app. To piggyback on this is a good option. These tests are also executed through our Jenkins pipeline for continuous testing. Which repo do you have your code in?
I would need to create a full flow. Do we have any documentations on how one would setup another TestRunner job

Hey Josh, this S3 test drive https://dogfood.instabase.com/ib_eng/tests/fs/Test%20Drive/ is shared across all releases and is used to run goldens. You can add your tests to this drive and test on the respective releases. You can either set up a regression test which will run as part of our regular golden runs through jenkins, or you can create a test suite and manually trigger them every time using the Test Runner (https://dogfood.instabase.com/apps/test-runner/) App.

Here are the docs for Test Runner https://dogfood.instabase.com/docs/apps/test-runner/. We have a PR in review which updates this and it should be merged very soon.
very cool. Thank you very much
